<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
SOCIAL MEDIA
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/05/28/trump-issues-executive-order-social-media-companies?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Trump Orders a Legal Headache for Social Media
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Social media executive order" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8xMTU5L3NvY2lhbF9tZWRpYV9leGVjdXRpdmVfb3JkZXIuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">After a week of jabbing and counter-jabbing, President Trump yesterday <a href="https://www.washingtonpost.com/technology/2020/05/28/trump-social-media-executive-order/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">issued an executive order</a> that aims to seriously diminish social media companies' legal protections. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">How it would do that:</strong> The order greases the wheels for a flood of lawsuits against social media companies. Get your federal agency Bingo cards out. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>First, it calls for the Commerce Department to petition the Federal Trade Commission to revisit the infamous Section 230 of the 1996 Communications Decency Act. That's the chunk of legalese that experts have called "the 26 words that created the internet." It gives social media platforms broad immunity to legal challenges over what users post. </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The order also directs the FTC to look into complaints of bias on the part of social media companies. </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Finally, it asks the DOJ to consult with a working group of attorneys general to surface complaints. </span></li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">How we got here</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Trump and his supporters argue social media companies show anti-conservative bias, and the administration has reportedly been considering an action like this since 2018. Then on Tuesday, Trump tweeted false claims about the death of a woman who once worked for TV host Joe Scarborough, which <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/05/26/widower-begs-dorsey-take-trump-tweets?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">provoked</a> outrage and calls for Twitter to fact check the president's posts. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Twitter left those tweets alone, but labeled other false information Trump posted about voter fraud as potentially misleading. It seems that led Trump to issue the order. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">What's Zuck saying?</strong> In interviews this week, Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg reiterated his anything-goes stance on user content. "I don't think Facebook or internet platforms in general should be arbiters of truth," he said. That’s a different approach than the one taken by Twitter and other social media firms, which haven’t commented on the order. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>the order is almost definitely going to face court challenges. It invokes the First Amendment, which <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/trump-to-sign-executive-order-targeting-social-media-11590681930?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">experts say</a> doesn't apply to private companies. And others question Trump bossing around independent agencies (like the FTC and FCC).</p>

<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
PUBLIC HEALTH
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/05/28/tensions-rise-state-mask-orders?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
No Shoes, No Mask, Yes Problems <em><br></em>
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="DTC panel newsletter crop" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC83ODgvZ2xvYmVfd2l0aF9hX21hc2suanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yesterday, NY Gov. Andrew Cuomo said he’ll <a href="https://www.businessinsider.com/new-york-to-allow-businesses-refuse-customers-without-masks-cuomo-2020-5?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">sign</a> an executive order allowing businesses to turn away customers if they’re not wearing masks. Not to be outdone, SF Mayor London Breed <a href="https://sanfrancisco.cbslocal.com/2020/05/28/san-francisco-lphased-plan-reopen-more-businesses-outdoor-activities/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">required residents</a> to wear a mask anytime they come within 30 feet of other people. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Mask requirements aren’t new.</strong> Some states and businesses started issuing them as early as April, though rules <a href="https://www.littler.com/publication-press/publication/facing-your-face-mask-duties-list-statewide-orders?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">vary widely</a> by state, industry, and who they apply to (employees, customers, or both). Some cities and counties also have differing rules. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Have we hit a boiling point?</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Disagreements over whether masks should be worn are turning into a “culture war,” and some patrons who refuse to don masks have protested outside stores. Some of those clashes have <a href="https://abcnews.go.com/US/incomprehensible-confrontations-masks-erupt-amid-covid-19-crisis/story?id=70494577&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">turned violent</a>, often harming employees and security guards. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">In many areas, residents are confused about who will enforce orders (some of which have misdemeanor penalties attached). Others are concerned about how early attempts to police social distancing showed <a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/news/nbcblk/pattern-uneven-social-distancing-enforcement-coming-view-civil-rights-experts-n1216506?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">uneven enforcement</a>: From mid-March to mid-May, about 81% of NYC citations were issued to black or Latino residents.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Big picture:</strong> Health officials have <a href="https://www.businessinsider.com/birx-clear-scientific-evidence-masks-work-trump-able-social-distance-2020-5?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">reiterated</a> that wearing a mask helps stop the spread of COVID-19. But masks are not a replacement for social distancing.</p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
ENERGY
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/05/28/us-renewables-consumption-tops-coal-first-time-130-years?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
The U.S. Airbends Its Way to a Milestone
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="coal and wind" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8xMTU3L2NvYWxfYW5kX3dpbmQucG5nIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>U.S. Energy Information Administration</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Last year, U.S. annual energy consumption from renewables topped coal consumption for the first time since before 1885, according to a <a href="https://www.eia.gov/todayinenergy/detail.php?id=43895&src=email&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">new report</a> from the Energy Information Administration (EIA).</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Back of the napkin math: </strong>Coal consumption dropped almost 15% from 2018, while renewables consumption grew 1%—mostly from wind and solar. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">We know what you're thinking…</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Was Abe Lincoln installing photovoltaics on the White House roof? What was the big renewable energy source in the 1800s? </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">That would be wood, </strong>the only commercial-scale renewable energy source in the U.S. before hydropower came along in the 1880s. Coal was used in the early 1800s to power boats and trains, then for making electricity in the later part of the century. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>While renewables consumption is steadily trending upward, that’s not the reason for coal's dramatic decline. <a href="https://www.eia.gov/energyexplained/electricity/electricity-in-the-us.php?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Natural gas</a> accounted for 38% of total electricity generation in the U.S. in 2019—the most of any source. </p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
TOURISM
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/05/28/cyprus-pay-lodging-expenses-tourists-contract-covid19?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
This One’s Gonna Test Our Self Control
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Cyprus marina " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8xMTU4L2N5cHJ1c19tYXJpbmEuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The Mediterranean island of Cyprus is reopening to international tourists on June 9, and it's thinking bigger than complimentary breakfast. Any tourist who tests positive for COVID-19 during their stay will have food, drinks, medicine, and lodging <a href="https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.cnbc.com/2020/05/28/cyprus-to-pay-for-the-vacation-of-tourists-who-catch-the-coronavirus.html&sa=D&ust=1590702164219000&usg=AFQjCNFJpCCXVZU_Dwl6MzkaxdR0_pwNOg&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">completely covered</a>. Once better, they'll just have to spring for the flight home. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Of course, Cyprus is really hoping you won’t get it. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Visitors have to test negative in their home country before heading over. </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Cyprus will also restrict travel from countries with bad outbreaks. </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Tourists have to park their umbrellas at least 12' away from other beachgoers, and groups are limited to 10 at restaurants and bars. </span></li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Big picture</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Cyprus tamped down its outbreak, but it needs more than halloumi and crystal clear waters to woo visitors. Tourism accounts for 13% of the island's economy, and it could lose up to 70% of that revenue this year. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The rest of the EU is also thinking about how it can salvage the summer travel season. Earlier this month, the bloc laid out guidelines to <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/05/13/europe-discussing-plans-reopen-shuttered-tourism-sector?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">restart tourism</a>, which accounts for ~10% of the continent's GDP.</p>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Giphy</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">What’s going on in the nation of Brew? Glad you asked.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Writing tips: </strong>Brew writer Eliza Carter is back with another glorious edition of the Brew’s style blog. In this post, you’ll finally understand the difference between further/farther and learn why all headlines sound the same. <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/05/28/morning-brew-style-blog-3-finally-nail-one-word?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Check it out</a>.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Work out with our CEO: </strong>Morning Brew chief Alex Lieberman did a 30 minute Instagram Live workout earlier this week with celeb fitness instructor Gina DiNapoli of Jabs by Gina. <a href="https://www.instagram.com/p/CApruD5BZLD/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">You will be sore</a>.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Explainers: </strong>Learn the basics of <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/05/17/jcpenney-dead-brew-unpacks-bankruptcy?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">bankruptcy</a>, <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/emerging-tech/guides/5g-in-2020?utm_source=etb_5g&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">5G wireless technology</a>, and <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/04/21/brews-guide-quarterly-earnings?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">earnings reports</a> with our fun guides.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The future of restaurants: </strong>This week, our podcast <em>Business Casual </em>featured some of the biggest names in the restaurant biz (like chef Marcus Samuelsson) to get their thoughts on the crisis facing the industry. <a href="https://www.businesscasual.fm/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Listen here</a>. </p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
FRIDAY PUZZLE
</h3>
</td>
</tr>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">There are several 9-letter words in the English language that have the following property: When you remove one letter from the word, each time it’ll make another word—no reordering necessary.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Ex: </strong></span><span>Splatters = Splatter...platter...latter...later...later...late...ate...at...a.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Can you think of another word with this property?</p>

style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0\"\u003e\nSOCIAL MEDIA \n\u003c/h3\u003e\n\u003ch1 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px\"\u003e\n\u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/05/28/trump-issues-executive-order-social-media-companies?email={{profile.email}}\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;\"\u003e\n\u003cfont color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nTrump Orders a Legal Headache for Social Media\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"Social media executive order\" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8xMTU5L3NvY2lhbF9tZWRpYV9leGVjdXRpdmVfb3JkZXIuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eFrancis Scialabba\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAfter a week of jabbing and counter-jabbing, President Trump yesterday \u003ca href=\"https://www.washingtonpost.com/technology/2020/05/28/trump-social-media-executive-order/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eissued an executive order\u003c/a\u003e that aims to seriously diminish social media companies' legal protections. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eHow it would do that:\u003c/strong\u003e The order greases the wheels for a flood of lawsuits against social media companies. Get your federal agency Bingo cards out. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eFirst, it calls for the Commerce Department to petition the Federal Trade Commission to revisit the infamous Section 230 of the 1996 Communications Decency Act. That's the chunk of legalese that experts have called \"the 26 words that created the internet.\" It gives social media platforms broad immunity to legal challenges over what users post. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe order also directs the FTC to look into complaints of bias on the part of social media companies. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eFinally, it asks the DOJ to consult with a working group of attorneys general to surface complaints. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eHow we got here\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eTrump and his supporters argue social media companies show anti-conservative bias, and the administration has reportedly been considering an action like this since 2018. Then on Tuesday, Trump tweeted false claims about the death of a woman who once worked for TV host Joe Scarborough, which \u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/05/26/widower-begs-dorsey-take-trump-tweets?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eprovoked\u003c/a\u003e outrage and calls for Twitter to fact check the president's posts. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eTwitter left those tweets alone, but labeled other false information Trump posted about voter fraud as potentially misleading. It seems that led Trump to issue the order. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhat's Zuck saying?\u003c/strong\u003e In interviews this week, Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg reiterated his anything-goes stance on user content. \"I don't think Facebook or internet platforms in general should be arbiters of truth,\" he said. That’s a different approach than the one taken by Twitter and other social media firms, which haven’t commented on the order. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead...\u003c/strong\u003ethe order is almost definitely going to face court challenges. It invokes the First Amendment, which \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/trump-to-sign-executive-order-targeting-social-media-11590681930?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eexperts say\u003c/a\u003e doesn't apply to private companies. And others question Trump bossing around independent agencies (like the FTC and FCC).\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eFrancis Scialabba\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eYesterday, NY Gov. Andrew Cuomo said he’ll \u003ca href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/new-york-to-allow-businesses-refuse-customers-without-masks-cuomo-2020-5?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esign\u003c/a\u003e an executive order allowing businesses to turn away customers if they’re not wearing masks. Not to be outdone, SF Mayor London Breed \u003ca href=\"https://sanfrancisco.cbslocal.com/2020/05/28/san-francisco-lphased-plan-reopen-more-businesses-outdoor-activities/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003erequired residents\u003c/a\u003e to wear a mask anytime they come within 30 feet of other people. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eMask requirements aren’t new.\u003c/strong\u003e Some states and businesses started issuing them as early as April, though rules \u003ca href=\"https://www.littler.com/publication-press/publication/facing-your-face-mask-duties-list-statewide-orders?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003evary widely\u003c/a\u003e by state, industry, and who they apply to (employees, customers, or both). Some cities and counties also have differing rules. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eHave we hit a boiling point?\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eDisagreements over whether masks should be worn are turning into a “culture war,” and some patrons who refuse to don masks have protested outside stores. Some of those clashes have \u003ca href=\"https://abcnews.go.com/US/incomprehensible-confrontations-masks-erupt-amid-covid-19-crisis/story?id=70494577\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eturned violent\u003c/a\u003e, often harming employees and security guards. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIn many areas, residents are confused about who will enforce orders (some of which have misdemeanor penalties attached). Others are concerned about how early attempts to police social distancing showed \u003ca href=\"https://www.nbcnews.com/news/nbcblk/pattern-uneven-social-distancing-enforcement-coming-view-civil-rights-experts-n1216506?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003euneven enforcement\u003c/a\u003e: From mid-March to mid-May, about 81% of NYC citations were issued to black or Latino residents.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBig picture:\u003c/strong\u003e Health officials have \u003ca href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/birx-clear-scientific-evidence-masks-work-trump-able-social-distance-2020-5?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ereiterated\u003c/a\u003e that wearing a mask helps stop the spread of COVID-19. collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eLast year, U.S. annual energy consumption from renewables topped coal consumption for the first time since before 1885, according to a \u003ca href=\"https://www.eia.gov/todayinenergy/detail.php?id=43895\u0026src=email\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003enew report\u003c/a\u003e from the Energy Information Administration (EIA).\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBack of the napkin math: \u003c/strong\u003eCoal consumption dropped almost 15% from 2018, while renewables consumption grew 1%—mostly from wind and solar. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eWe know what you're thinking…\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWas Abe Lincoln installing photovoltaics on the White House roof? What was the big renewable energy source in the 1800s? \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThat would be wood, \u003c/strong\u003ethe only commercial-scale renewable energy source in the U.S. before hydropower came along in the 1880s. Coal was used in the early 1800s to power boats and trains, then for making electricity in the later part of the century. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line: \u003c/strong\u003eWhile renewables consumption is steadily trending upward, that’s not the reason for coal's dramatic decline. \u003ca href=\"https://www.eia.gov/energyexplained/electricity/electricity-in-the-us.php?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eNatural gas\u003c/a\u003e accounted for 38% of total electricity generation in the U.S. in 2019—the most style=\"color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;\"\u003e\n\u003cfont color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nThis One’s Gonna Test Our Self 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eGetty Images\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe Mediterranean island of Cyprus is reopening to international tourists on June 9, and it's thinking bigger than complimentary breakfast. Any tourist who tests positive for COVID-19 during their stay will have food, drinks, medicine, and lodging \u003ca href=\"https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.cnbc.com/2020/05/28/cyprus-to-pay-for-the-vacation-of-tourists-who-catch-the-coronavirus.html\u0026sa=D\u0026ust=1590702164219000\u0026usg=AFQjCNFJpCCXVZU_Dwl6MzkaxdR0_pwNOg\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ecompletely covered\u003c/a\u003e. Once better, they'll just have to spring for the flight home. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eOf course, Cyprus is really hoping you won’t get it. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eVisitors have to test negative in their home country before heading over. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eCyprus will also restrict travel from countries with bad outbreaks. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eTourists have to park their umbrellas at least 12' away from other beachgoers, and groups are limited to 10 at restaurants and bars. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eBig picture\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eCyprus tamped down its outbreak, but it needs more than halloumi and crystal clear waters to woo visitors. Tourism accounts for 13% of the island's economy, and it could lose up to 70% of that revenue this year. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe rest of the EU is also thinking about how it can salvage the summer travel season. Earlier this month, the bloc laid out guidelines to \u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/05/13/europe-discussing-plans-reopen-shuttered-tourism-sector?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003erestart tourism\u003c/a\u003e, which accounts for ~10% of the continent's GDP.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS
